intro: Impatiens montalbana, commonly known as the Montalban impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that come in a range of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its stems are slender and often branching. Impatiens montalbana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
